metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5261 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in SPICE before 0.12.6 allows guest OS users to read and write to arbitrary memory locations on the host via guest QXL commands related to surface creation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2
spice-client - 0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2').
